question: What is the purpose of the weighted average study results?
answer: The weighted average study results express a studentâ€™s average grade evaluation in a given section of the studies.
answer_generated: The purpose of the weighted average study results is to express a studentâ€™s average grade evaluation in a given section of the studies, such as a semester or academic year, based on the credits and grades of completed subjects (Article 12)(1).

Article  12 
Weighted  average  study  results  
(1) A studentâ€™s  average  grade  evaluation  in the given  section  of the studies  (a semester,  an academic  
year  or an otherwise  defined  unit of study)  is expressed  by weighted  average  study  results  (VP) 
defined  as follows:

duly  completed  pursuant  to Article  6 hereof  in the given  section  of the studies.  
 (2) The average  grade  evaluation  under  Para  1 hereof  will be rounded  to two decimal  places.
